key_points: A massive cargo ship named the Ever Given is blocking the Suez Canal, causing significant economic disruption.
Lloyd's List estimates the blockage costs the global economy $400 million per hour in delayed goods.
The Suez Canal is a crucial trade route that connects Europe to Asia.
The Ever Given has been lodged in the canal since early Tuesday.
An average of $9.7 billion worth of cargo goods pass through the canal daily.
Approximately 93 vessels pass through the canal daily, causing nearly 300 vessels to be blocked so far.
The ship's owner, Japanese company Shoei Kisen, hopes to free the vessel by Saturday.
The blockage exacerbates the already-strained global supply chain, affected by the pandemic.
Some ships are rerouting around Africa's southern tip, which is a longer, more dangerous, and costly journey.
Efforts to dislodge the ship include clearing sand and mud and using tugboats.
